Pam Halpert originally began her journey into the world of art as a
receptionist for Dunder Mifflin Inc. (a paper company) in Scranton,
Pennsylvania. She was then accepted into the Pratt Institute where
she began to hone her skills. Many of her pieces from her student
art show at the end of her time at the Institute are shown on this
site. After her time at the Institute, she returned to Dunder
Mifflin Inc. for a time (with a brief stint at the Michael Scott
Paper Company). Eventually, she returned to her true passion: art.
She now lives in Austin, Texas as a freelance painter and an art
gallery owner. She lives with her husband, Jim, and two beautiful
children, Cecilia and Philip (all shown to the left).
